poem:
Title: Les Adieux

One shed, a bottle of shared regret,
in the heat of pandemic and the twilight of love,
the end of the line confessed over clinked glasses.
Next morning's walk, 15,000 steps alone,
each footfall a goodbye, each heel strike, a fresh start.
In divorce's bitter sting, solitude found its sweet,
in the kilometered cadence of a healed heart.
